answers.author: Derek Johnson
answers.text:
Richard,  
I was able to find two documents which may be of assistance to you.  
Attached to this reply is a billboard development policy guide created by the Planning and Building Department of the City of Calgary. It's not domestic, so the bylaws may be different from what you're dealing with in California, but it may still be instructive.


Richard,  

I was able to find two documents which may be of assistance to you.  

Attached to this reply is a billboard development policy guide created by the Planning and Building Department of the City of Calgary. It's not domestic, so the bylaws may be different from what you're dealing with in California, but it may still be instructive.

answers.author: Derek Johnson
answers.text:
This second document is domestic in origin but is not nearly as comprehensive as the Calgary document. It's from the Michigan Association of Planning and lists 8 short policy recommendations for localities in regards to billboard renting and use along highways.

author: Richard Ramirez
text: Are there any cities who own or allow billboards or message boards on City Property and sell advertising?  What has been theri experience?
title: City owned billboards
